Social policy

We want the voice of the people we work with to be heard and to empower them to speak for themselves.

Partnering for social impact

Better social policy is one of the three strategic priorities in the organisation's strategic plan Vision 2020 - we share our learnings to influence effective policies that have greater impact and create better oportunities for all of us, especially the people we support. We want the voice of people we work with to be heard and to empower them to speak for themselves.

We drawon our experience in delivering quality services, implementing new service and funding models; and provide a commitment to evidence-based practice.

We partner with other organisations andn individuals to get our message heard, as well as being the lead on some initiatives.

To read more about how Life Without Barriers is upholding Human Rights and supporting employment opportunities for people with disability, refer to the resources below:

Life Without Barriers - Human Rights Statement Working

    RECONCILIATION STATEMENT

    In the spirit of Reconciliation, UNITYCARE acknowledges Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples as the Traditional Owners and Custodians of this country, and acknowledges their connection to land, water and community. We pay our respect to them, their cultures and customs, and to Elders past, present and emerging.

    Learn more about our steps towards reconciliation
